text: Rainer Maria Rilke (4 December 1875 â€“ 29 December 1926), was an Austrian poet and writer. His best-known works include the collection of poetry Duino Elegies, Sonnets to Orpheus, and the novel The Notebooks of Malte Laurids Brigge. Rilke was born in Prague, Austro-Hungarian Empire. Rilke studied literature, art history, and philosophy in Munich and Prague. He travelled widely throughout Europe and North Africa. He died of leukemia in Montreux, Switzerland. == Other websites == * * Works by or about Rainer Maria Rilke * Rainer Maria Rilke, Profile Category:1875 births Category:1926 deaths Category:Austrian poets Category:Cancer deaths in Switzerland Category:Deaths from leukemia Category:Writers from Prague
title: Rainer Maria Rilke
